sense.name: forcibly take away
sense.commentary: NOTE: compare carefully to sense 2; this is a more general sense, and includes abstract usages
sense.examples: He robbed us of some big goals in big moments. He robbed me of the little space I stole. He robbed me of my courage, my trust in others, confidence in my own judgment.

sense.name: commit robbery
sense.commentary: NOTE: compare carefully to sense 1; this is a subset of sense 1, specific to a criminal act; the objects stolen are usually not stated.
sense.examples: We were robbed! Seventeen percent reported their customers being robbed. I was robbed at gunpoint during my first job. He robbed me of a wallet.
